title: Understanding Domain
text: What values can $$x$$ take in any quadratic function? Are there any restrictions?

title: Understanding Range
text: What does the 'a' value (the coefficient of the squared term) tell us about the direction in which the parabola opens?

title: Finding the Vertex
text: The vertex form of a quadratic function is $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$. What are the vertex coordinates for $$f(x)={2\left(x-\frac{4}{7}\right)}^2+\frac{8}{11}$$? Please enter your answer in the form (x, y).

title: Range Based on Vertex
text: Does the vertex represent a maximum or minimum value for the function?

title: Determining the Range
text: Since the coefficient of the squared term is positive, the parabola opens upward. Thus, what is the range of f(x)? Please enter your answer in the form $$f(x) \geq a$$ where a is the appropriate answer

title: Finding the Domain
text: Since any real number $$x$$ can be plugged into the quadratic function, what is the domain for f(x)? Please enter your answer in the form $$a<x<b$$ where a and $$b$$ are the appropriate answers.

title: Final Verification
text: Combine the domain and range of f(x) to express the complete answer.

title: Final Answer
text: State both the domain and range for the function $$f(x)={2\left(x-\frac{4}{7}\right)}^2+\frac{8}{11}$$.
